title: 105_hr2649
content: The "Expedited Rescissions Act of 1997" repeals the Line Item Veto Act of 1996 and introduces expedited consideration of certain proposed rescissions under the Congressional Budget and Impoundment Control Act of 1974. The President can propose rescinding budget authority provided in an appropriation Act within 3 days of enactment, with a draft bill specifying the amount to be rescinded. This process cannot be repeated for the same funds. The President can propose rescinding budget authority within 3 days of enactment, specifying the amount to be rescinded for each program. Separate messages are required for accounts under different subcommittees, detailing the budget authority to be rescinded. After a special message is transmitted to Congress, the majority or minority leader of the House of Representatives must introduce the draft bill accompanying the message. If not introduced, any Member of the House may introduce the bill on the third legislative day. The bill will be referred to the Committee on Appropriations, which must report the bill without substantive revision by the seventh legislative day. The Committee on Appropriations must report the bill without revision by the seventh legislative day. A vote on final passage of the bill should be taken in the House of Representatives by the 10th legislative day. If passed, the bill will be transmitted to the Senate within one day. Debate in the House of Representatives on a bill under this section shall not exceed 4 hours, divided equally between those favoring and opposing the bill. Motion to limit debate or reconsider the vote is not debatable. No amendments to the motion are allowed. The Rules of the House of Representatives apply to the procedure for a bill under this section, decided without debate. A bill sent to the Senate goes to the Committee on Appropriations, which must report it within seven legislative days. If not reported, the committee is discharged, and the bill is placed on the calendar. The Senate must vote on the bill within the 10th legislative day after receiving it. The Senate has specific rules for considering bills under this section, including privileged motions, limited debate time, and restrictions on amendments and reconsideration. The Senate has rules for considering bills under this section, including limited debate time and restrictions on amendments and reconsideration. Debate time is limited to 1 hour, divided between the mover and the bill manager, with additional time allotted by leaders. Amendments to bills under this section are prohibited in both the House and Senate. The Senate has rules for considering bills under this section, including limited debate time and restrictions on amendments and reconsideration. It shall not be in order to demand a division of the question in the House of Representatives or the Senate. Any amount of budget authority proposed to be rescinded in a special message shall be made available for obligation after certain conditions are met. The bill allows rescissions to be made in accordance with the President's special message. It also amends certain sections related to rulemaking powers and definitions in the Act. The bill amends Section 1011 and Section 1015 of the Act by updating paragraph numbers and references. The bill updates paragraph numbers and references in Section 1011 and Section 1015 of the Act, including changes to subsection (e)(2) and Section 1016. The bill updates paragraph numbers and references in Section 1011 and Section 1015 of the Act, including changes to subsection (e)(2) and Section 1016. Clerical amendments are made to the table of sections for subpart B of title X of the Act. "Sec. 1013. Expedited consideration of certain proposed rescissions." Section 1013 of the Congressional Budget and Impoundment Control Act of 1974 applies to budget authority provided by appropriation Acts enacted during the One Hundred Fifth Congress and thereafter. The President may propose rescinding budget authority within 3 days of a new Congress if the previous Congress did not consider the proposed rescissions before adjourning. The President may propose rescinding budget authority within 3 days of a new Congress if the previous Congress did not consider the proposed rescissions before adjourning. A draft bill must accompany a special message for rescissions, to be introduced in the House of Representatives within two legislative days. If not introduced, any Member may introduce the bill on the third legislative day. The House and Senate will then consider the bill as per section 1013.
